Core:PCProperties.Core:Property:
(\{ "visitors", "\\\r\\n\\t\\\\\\r\\n\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Head/Neck\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\
\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Alligator Helmet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\An alligator skull repurposed to work as a helmet. Requires 1 alligator skull.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Armet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\This helmet was one of the first to completely enclose the head whilst being light enough to move with the wearer. A typical armet consisted of four pieces: the skull, two hinged cheek pieces that lock at the front, and the visor. There was a multi-part reinforcement for the bottom half of the face, known as a wrapper, which was sometimes added, and its straps attached to a metal disk at the base of the skull piece called a rondel. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Barbute\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Characterized by a rounded skull, a t-shaped opening for the face, a strongly flared tail, and cheek pieces, this helmet has been executed to form a very elegant, flowing defense for the head. It is layered on top with velvet cloth which has been covered with a latten floral adornment. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Bascinet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It is an open-faced, military helmet, typically fitted with a hinged visor and worn with a gorget. For comfort, there is a linen blend cloth stuffed with wool on this inside of the close-fitting helmet, and, though there is no chin strap, this helmet was often tied to a surcoat or armor to prevent it from being lifted off the wearer's head. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\\
\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Great Bascinet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A development from the pig-faced or hound skull bascinets which are shorter, it features aventail protection for the throat and neck and combines a rounded skullcap and rounded nose design. The face is protected by a hinged visor pierced with numerous holes for sight and ventilation. It comes complete with an adjustable chin strap to better fit the helmet to the head. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Burgonet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A burgonet with bevor. This helm affords protection to the neck as well as the head and face. It boasts a fully articulated falling buffe that is secured by leather straps which can be adjusted to allow for better air flow and visibility. An impressive fin decorates the top, while the visor is adorned with simple cut-out crosses. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Capeline\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It is also known as a lobster pot. The lobster-tailed pot had ear flaps, a visor that included a sliding nasal bar to protect the trooper from sword thrusts and an articulated 'tail' protecting the back of the head that was said to resemble a lobster.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Cervelliere\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A copper cervelliere. It is a round, close-fitting skull cap; this helmet was frequently worn beneath a great helm (heaume). Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Coif\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A shoulder-length piece of armor comprised of many intricately joined links covering the top, back and sides of the head and neck. Craftable from leather. Requires 3 feet of fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Heaume\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It is a flat-topped, cylindrical helmet that completely covers the head and has small openings for the eyes and mouth. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Hounskull\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The hounskull was a form of bascinet with a visor covering the entire face. It is the visor which gives the helmet its name, as this resembles the face of a dog (\"hound\" or, in Northern, \"Hund\"), with a protruding muzzle in order to better protect the face from blows and to grant greater ventilation (which was largely afforded the wearer, when the visor was down, through holes in the \"muzzle\", such holes being either on the right side of the \"muzzle\" with additional holes near the mouth, or on both sides). Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Kettle Hat\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It is a type of helmet made from metal in the shape of a hat. The only common element is a wide brim that afforded extra protection for the wearer. It was worn by troops of all types, but most commonly by infantry. The wide brim gave good protection against blows from above, such as from cavalry sabres, and were very useful in siege warfare as the wide brim would protect the wearer from projectiles shot or dropped from above. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Morion Helmet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A morion is a type of open helmet with a crest or comb at the top designed to strengthen it, with a rim circling the lower edge. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Sallet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Suitable for foot or mounted combat, this two-tiered helmet is constructed with a tail to protect the back of the head and neck. It sits flush on a bevor, which protects the chin and throat. Featuring a moveable visor which provides for good ventilation and visibility, and a bevor with falling buffe, it is forged of iron and fully lined. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Open-faced Sallet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\This open-faced helmet, also referred to as an Archer's Sallet, is common wear amongst crossbowmen and archers, as it allows for an unobstructed view of targets by providing a clear line of sight. It features a rounded skullcap, matching round brim, and includes an adjustable leather liner and chin strap. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Spangenhelm\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The name is of Northern origin. Spangen refers to the metal straps that form the framework for the helmet and could be translated as clips, and -helm simply means helmet. The strips connect three to six plates (normally steel or bronze). The frame takes a conical design that curves with the shape of the head and culminates in a point. The front of the helmet includes a nose protector (a nasal) and cheek flaps made from leather. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Traditional Helmet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Helmets protect the wearer against blows to the head. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers head.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Bevor\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A piece of armor designed to protect the neck, much like a gorget. It is comprised of multiple articulated lames around the neck and chin, and is typically worn in conjunction with a sallet or a burgonet in a form known as a falling buffe. It combines with other pieces to provide protection for the whole of the head and neck. Requires 3 feet of metal. Covers neck.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Gorget\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A cover for the neck, shoulders, clavicles, and sternum, the top attaches directly to the base of a helmet while the bottom fastens to a breastplate or cuirass. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 2 yards for fabric. Covers neck.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Heavy Gorget\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Originally designed for blunt weapons combat, the mantle of this neck piece is composed of thick leather, and is riveted to the curved upper collar which is crafted from hardened material and serves to help deflect attacks away from the throat. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers neck.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Shields\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\
\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Shield\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A simple, round shield. Requires 5 feet of metal.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Buckler\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A small, round disk-shaped shield, very light and maneuverable to block fast quick blows. Requires 5 feet of metal.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Kite\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The kite shield appears to be the reverse of a tear drop, the tapering point extending down into a distinct tip. Popular amongst professional soldiers, the shield allows them to protect their foreleg when in a melee. It features a gradual curve to better fit the contours of the torso. Requires 5 feet of metal.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Heater\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The heater shield is a form of shield characterized by its distinctive shape. Smaller than the kite-shield, it is more manageable and can be used either mounted or on foot. It is flat-topped and tapers down into a pointed tip. Requires 5 feet of metal.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Tower\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\This shield is roughly the size of a fully-grown man. It is curved slightly so that it can be held close to ones body and provide a great deal of protection. Its crippling weight makes it rather ineffective to maneuver with. Spears and other polearms are often favored to be used with this shield.Requires 5 feet of metal.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Chest/Torso\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\
\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Cuirass\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A cuirass is a piece of armor formed of a single or multiple pieces of metal or other rigid material, which covers the front of the wearer's person. In a suit of armor this important piece was generally connected to a back piece and cuirass could refer to the complete torso-protecting armor. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 6 feet for metal and 6 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Breastplate\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The front is curved to protect from spear blows to the chest. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 4 feet for metal and 4 yards for fabric. Covers chest.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Lorica\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A small breastplate that protects the sternum and the ribs and attaches around the neck. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 2 feet for metal and 2 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Rondel\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\This is a circular piece of metal used for protection, as a harness of plate armor, or attached to a helmet, breastplate, couter, or on a gauntlet. Craftable from metal or leather. Requires 1 foot for metal and 1 yard for leather. Covers torso.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Culet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A piece of plate armor consisting of small, horizontal lames that protect the small of the back or the buttocks. Requires 4 feet of metal.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Mail Shirt\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It is a piece of plate armor, designed to be worn below a breastplate for the protection of the waist and hips. Taking the form of bands of metal surrounding both legs, potentially surrounding the entire hips, this form is similar to that of a skirt. Craftable from chainmail. Requires 2 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Brigandine\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A shirt-like piece of armor protectively covering the shoulders, chest, waist, and back. It is comprised of medium weight hardened fabric plates, is form-fitting, and extremely flexible. Craftable from chainmail. Requires 4 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Aventail\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A flexible curtain on a helmet that extends to cover the neck and shoulders. A leather cord is used to attach it to the base of the helmet by threading it through metal rings. Craftable from chainmail. Requires 2 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Hauberk\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\An armor made from chains linked together tightly. It covers most of the upper body, consisting of the torso and arms. Craftable from chainmail. Requires 4 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Body Harness\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A protective covering for the shoulders, chest, waist, and back. It is comprised of rectangular leather lammelae laced in horizontal rows. Craftable from leather and chainmail. Requires 3 yards for fabric.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Shoulders/Arms\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\
\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Spaulders\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The spaulders, a part of plate armor, are armored plates forged to protect the upper arms and shoulders. As these do not cover the arm holes when worn with a cuirass, the gaps may be defended by besagews or simply left bare, exposing the mail beneath. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers shoulders and biceps.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Pauldrons\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A pair of pauldrons; larger than spaulders, these are a component of plate armor made to cover the shoulders, armpits, and sometimes parts of the back and chest. Typically, pauldrons tend to consist of a single dome-shaped piece to cover the shoulder with multiple lame attached to defend the arm. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 yards for fabric. Covers armpits, shoulders, shoulderblades.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Ailettes\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Usually made from cuir bouilli (sometimes plate or parchment), ailettes attached to the shoulders by means of silk of leather cord. They are usually flat and rectangular in shape, and usually decorated with heraldic designs. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 2 feet for metal and 2 yards for fabric. Covers shoulders.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Besagews\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The bronze besagews are circular defenses used to protect the under arms, the armpits particularly, as part of a harness of plate armor. Requires 1 foot of armor. Covers armpits.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Couters\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The couters are a component in a piece of plate armor, they are used in defense of the elbows. They are forged into an articulate joint. Requires 1 foot of metal. Covers elbows.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Gauntlets\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A pair of plates worn as gloves. They protect the backs of hands and the wrists, and are made of many smaller plates that allow flexibility of the fingers. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 2 feet for metal and 2 yards for fabric. Covers hands and fingers.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Bracers\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A pair of plates wrapped around the wrists, usually worn by archers or fencers for protection. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 2 feet for metal and 2 yards for fabric. Covers wrists.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Rerebraces\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It consists of two upper cannons on the upper arms, it is usually connected to the lower cannon, protection for the forearms, by couters at the elbow. Requires 4 feet of metal. Covers biceps.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Vambraces\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It consists of two lower cannons on the forearms, it is usually connected to the upper cannon, protection for the upper arm, by couters at the elbow. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 4 feet for metal and 4 yards for fabric. Covers forearms.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Legs/Feet\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\
\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Schynbalds\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\These are metal plates strapped over chausses, each schynbald was a single piece of metal that covered the front and outside of the shin. They did not enclose the lower leg: hence, they were not true greaves. Requires 2 feet of metal. Covers shins.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Greaves\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\A pair of plates wrapping the front sides of the lower legs for protection. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 4 feet for metal and 4 yards for fabric. Covers calves and ankles.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Poleyns\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Developed with an articulated construction, these are plates designed for protecting the knees. They can be attached to cuisses or greaves, as desired. Requires 2 feet of metal. Covers knees and thighs.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Sabatons\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\These are rivetted plates that are worn upon the feet and protect them from damage while allowing movement and flexibility. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 4 feet for metal and 4 yards for fabric. Covers feet.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Waist\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\
\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Codpiece\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\It is a flap or pouch that attaches to the front of the crotch of men's pants to provide covering for the genitals. It was held closed by string ties, buttons, or other methods. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 1 foot for metal and 1 yard for fabric. Covers groin.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Chastity belt\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 2 feet for metal and 1 yard for fabric. Covers groin.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Cuisses\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The bronze cuisses. It is a curved shield made to protect the thighs from a thrust from below. These typically cover chausses and may have a pair of poleyns directly attached to them. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 3 feet for metal and 3 feet for fabric. Covers thighs.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Tassets\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The iron tassets are a piece of plate armor made to protect the upper legs. Either hanging from a breastplate or faulds, the plates can be forged from a single piece or segmented. Craftable from metal and leather. Requires 4 feet for metal and 4 feet for leather. Covers thighs.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Fauld\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\The bronze fauld, a piece of plate armor, are designed to be worn below a breastplate for the protection of the waist and hips. Taking the form of bands of metal surrounding both legs, potentially surrounding the entire hips, this form is similar to that of a skirt. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 5 feet for metal and 5 feet for fabric. Covers hips and waist.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\
\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\Bases\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\t\
\\r\\n\\t\\t\\t\\\This is plate armor for the upper legs, in imitation of the shape and style of cloth bases. It is worn for dismounted combat. There is a detachable rear piece for the metal bases to allow the man-at-arms to sit on a destrier, or any other lizard, although even without the rear piece it must have been rather difficult to mount and dismount when wearing plate armor bases. Craftable from metal, leather, and chainmail. Requires 5 feet for metal and 4 yards for fabric. Covers thighs, waist, and hips.\\\\\r\\n\\t\\t\\\r\\n\\t\\\r\\n\" \})
